sen.j: 石原駅（いさえき）は、京都府福知山市にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線の駅。
sen.e: Located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, Isa Station is a stop on the San'in Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Isa Station, located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the San'in Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Isa Station, located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Sanin Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 難読駅名として有名。
sen.e: It is famous for the difficult station name to read.
It is famous for having a name that is difficult to read.
It is famous for having a name that is difficult to read.

sen.j: 山陰本線の駅ではあるが、綾部駅を介して直通してくる舞鶴線の一部列車も利用可能。
sen.e: The station is for the San'in Main Line, but some trains on the Maizuru Line stop at this station via Ayabe Station.
The station is intended for the San'in Main Line, but some trains on the Maizuru Line make stops at this station via Ayabe Station.
The station is intended for the Sanin Main Line, but some trains on the Maizuru Line make stops at this station via Ayabe Station.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 島式1面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: The station is on the ground with an island platform, which is a single platform between double tracks.
The station is on the ground with an island platform that provides a single platform between double tracks.
The station is on the ground with an island platform that provides a single platform between double tracks.

sen.j: 無人駅である。
sen.e: This station does not have any station staff.
This station has no station staff.
This station has no station staff.

sen.j: 下り線南側に小さな駅舎があり、そこに自動券売機が設置されている。
sen.e: The station-house is on the south side of the outbound line, and an automatic ticket machine is set up in the station-house.
The station house is on the south side of the outbound line, and an automatic ticket machine is provided in the station house.
The station house is on the south side of the outbound line, and an automatic ticket machine is provided in the station house.

sen.j: 駅舎からホームへは跨線橋で連絡する。
sen.e: The station-house and the platform are connected by an overpass.
The station house and the platform are connected by an overpass.
The station house and the platform are connected by an overpass.

sen.j: 便所は、改札内に男女別の汲み取り式便所がある。
sen.e: The rest room is inside of the ticket gate, with the sexes separated, vault toilet type.
The restroom is within the confines of the ticket gate, with the sexes separated, and the toilets are of the vault type.
The restroom is within the confines of the ticket gate, with the sexes separated, and the toilets are of the vault type.

sen.e: Utilization situation
Conditions of usage

sen.cmt: 表現を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約351人である。
sen.e: Number of usage is about 351 people a day on research in fiscal 2006.
According to research conducted in fiscal 2006, the usage totaled approximately 351 people per day.
According to research conducted in fiscal year 2006, the station was used by approximately 351 people each day.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Statistical data of Kyoto Prefecture)
(Statistical data of Kyoto Prefecture)
(according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)

sen.j: 府立工業高校への通学の利用が多い。
sen.e: Many of passengers are students of the prefectural industrial high school.
Many passengers are students of the Prefectural Industrial High School.
Many passengers are students of the Prefectural High School of Technology.
sen.cmt: 学校名を修正しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）11月3日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on November 3, 1904 as a station of Japan National Railways (JNR).
The station opened on November 3, 1904 as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).
November 3, 1904: The station opened as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).

sen.j: 即日阪鶴鉄道に貸与。
sen.e: On the same day, it was given to Hankaku Railway in loans.
On the same day, it was loaned to Hankaku Railway.
On the same day, it was loaned to Hankaku Railway.

sen.j: 客貨取扱を開始。
sen.e: Transport service for passengers and freights was started.
Transportation services for passengers and freights were initiated.
Transportation services for passengers and freights were initiated.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月1日 - 阪鶴鉄道が国有化。
sen.e: Hankaku Railway was nationalized on August 1, 1907.
Hankaku Railway was nationalized on August 1, 1907.
August 1, 1907: Hankaku Railway was nationalized.

sen.j: 1971年（昭和46年）8月26日 - 貨物取扱を廃止。
sen.e: Freight service was ceased on August 26, 1971.
Freight service ceased on August 26, 1971.
August 26, 1971: Freight service ceased.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化によりJR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: The station became one of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of JNR on April 1, 1987.
The station became part of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of JNR on April 1, 1987.
April 1, 1987: The station became part of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of JNR.
